Keywords: Armor , Brute , Deity , Soldier , Warrior
Real Name: Ares
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Ally
THE ENGINES OF WAR GRIND ON: SIDELINE ACTIVE, UNIQUE MODIFIER - Friendly Captains and Sidekicks modify attack +1 when attacking 1+ characters with the Soldier keyword.
THEY FIGHT FOR MY AMUSEMENT: When a character named Allied Soldier or German Soldier is KO'd, give Ares an Endless War token. // At the beginning of your turn, for every 2 Endless War Tokens that he has, gain 1 Mission Point.
A VISION OF NEVER-ENDING BATTLE: Leadership, but succeeds on a 4-6. When he uses it and succeeds, you may instead generate an Allied Soldier bystander -or- a German Soldier bystander. If you do, an opponent also generates an Allied Soldier bystander -or- German Soldier bystander, whichever you did not choose, adjacent to one of their characters (the bystander they generate is friendly to their force).

June 2, 2021
jtallday
While he makes G/A soldiers, he triggers in any sidekick so I'd rather go with Minotaur at 20 points since they have charge/blades. With the hose to plexing damage, blades is huge for doing bigger damage these days. I intend to push on both fronts damage and mission points. Add Herbie for more life and MPs. Add Thing for toughness, Andy for Shape Change and Spiderman for Super Senses and those are some brutal Minotaurs.
May 29, 2021
Goop
Ares is probably your best shot to win via mission points, however you can't just rely on his leadership roll. Plan to bring at least 10x 20pt allied/german soldiers along with him. Run em in, tie up your opponents and hopefully force your opponent to kill them all. This could be fun in higher point games or battle royals.
May 1, 2021
fastcat99
So the tokens stay for the game, right? If I already have 2 tokens get a VP at start of my turn, then I KO a couple more of the soldiers, I get two more tokens, so now I have 4 so every turn, I'm generating 2 VPs each turn.
April 30, 2021
peeterparkker
So Ares teams up with that character who kills everyone with the same name (I forget which fig it is. we'll call him Sam) and you give him an equipment that gives him energy explosion. Play several allied soldiers and throw them at your opponent. Ares generates doods and Sam energy explodes them, killing all of them quickly. Yay splash damage. Should rack up mission points pretty quickly.

@Yelak You'd be surprised. During the prerelease I won because of time/points, but I was two rounds away from winning with his Mission Points. They can add up pretty quickly.
April 29, 2021
Skeleman
[QUOTE]So this mission point thing is never going to happen. You have to kill 40 “soldiers” to get your 20 mission points. Ares creates 2 “if” he hits his leadership. So if you hit leadership every turn that would take like 21 turns of you and your opponent killing “soldiers”. I realize you can start with the generic soldiers on your force but then they have 3 clicks each and harder to kill.[/QUOTE] It would happen much quicker. He gets 1 mission point each turn for every 2 endless war tokens but the endless war tokens are never removed. Meaning if he creates his first two soldiers and they are killed he gets 2 endless war tokens and next turn he gets 1 mission point. If he creates two more soldiers and they are killed that's 2 more endless war tokens for a total of 4 and 2 more mission points the next turn. It's unlikely but if Ares gets his leadership every turn and the 2 solders die every turn Ares would win at the beginning of turn 7.
April 28, 2021
Yelak
So this mission point thing is never going to happen. You have to kill 40 “soldiers” to get your 20 mission points. Ares creates 2 “if” he hits his leadership. So if you hit leadership every turn that would take like 21 turns of you and your opponent killing “soldiers”. I realize you can start with the generic soldiers on your force but then they have 3 clicks each and harder to kill.
